TopicTitle: [0.25] Lionhead Aerospace Inc. - Icarus v0.4 updated

Articles.Content:
Is there enough fuel in the ascent stage?

Enough to get to 15km orbit and randezvous with CSM on 25km orbit. I used MechJeb to test it but still there was like c.300 m/s left, so everyone should be able to do it.

And yes, I lost engine while landing (this brave maneuver included even a barrel roll - don't ask).

Enough to get to 15km orbit and randezvous with CSM on 25km orbit. I used MechJeb to test it but still there was like c.300 m/s left, so everyone should be able to do it.

And yes, I lost engine while landing (this brave maneuver included even a barrel roll - don't ask).

Yogui87

LOL. He spaming me PM too. )))

All stuff you need to know..In fact 2 of them involve that reference you were gonna use..

Is the problem with the rovers because of cleverbobcat? There's a .20 version available.

We already tried that, it doesn't work with the rovers lionhead has for some reason.
A scaling issue? Just spitballin' here... Colliders? It's specifically the wheels right? Edited May 28, 2013 by Good_Apollo
We already tried that, it doesn't work with the rovers lionhead has for some reason.

Yogui87..

Maybe a bit of a weird one for you, but...

If you could make replicas of both the Dawn and Rosetta spacecraft, that would be very very cool

Yogui87..

Maybe a bit of a weird one for you, but...

If you could make replicas of both the Dawn and Rosetta spacecraft, that would be very very cool

It's not weird at all. I planed making a probe/satellite pack a little later.

It's not weird at all. I planed making a probe/satellite pack a little later.

I was thinking a satellite pack was really missing. As well as a good station pack.
I'm definately thinking that a Dawn and Rosetta pack are missing. But then again, I would...
I, myself am still waiting on that Viking 1 lander.

If you, yogui, or anyone you/you guys know feel up to it, there's a suggestion that was sadly lost in the site wipe.

http://www.wired.com/wiredscience/2012/10/origin-of-the-apollo-shaped-manned-mars-lander-1966/

Basicly, everything about the M.E.M. and it's class of vehicles just scream "MOD ME! MOD ME! I WANT TO LIVE!", and I'm surprised no one has started working on this.

I think this is a more updated version of it. (not official)

Edited May 29, 2013 by Tommygun

I think this is a more updated version of it. (not official)

*snip*

That looks awesome.
Is this sacecraft got a name? I want to see if I can find more stuff about it.

Is this sacecraft got a name? I want to see if I can find more stuff about it.
Its Wernher von Braun's mars lander.

That one is the Boeing North American Manned Mars Lander.

It's from 1968, so it's hard to find good information on it.

I did several long web searches on it a few months back when I made my own version of it from stock and modded parts.

It was part of the Boeing's Integrated Program Plan Interplanetary Spacecraft

I'll see if I still have any links for it.

Edit: small article, just back ground information.

https://falsesteps.wordpress.com/2012/08/08/mars-expedition-1969-nasas-waterloo/

http://www.astronautix.com/craft/mem.htm

Edited May 29, 2013 by Tommygun

This might sound stupid...but Im gonna ask anyway, are you going to to the Diamant someday? I understand that we wont really be able to lift anything with it, except a barebones LKO sat, but its a very nice, historical rocket...

Here is something, I believe, which is called a "render" of that rocket :

http://andegraf.com/rockets/diamand.htm

This might sound stupid...but Im gonna ask anyway, are you going to to the Diamant someday? I understand that we wont really be able to lift anything with it, except a barebones LKO sat, but its a very nice, historical rocket...

Yes Diamant is planned, moreover it's a french rocket, I can't avoid making it. On my schedule there're Ariane 4 (may be Ariane 1 to 3), Diamant, Vega and Europe.

Btw, do you know what happened with this Ariane?

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/10400-Ariane-5-and-other-Projects-under-development
I don't know what happen to him. May be he left KSP.
I think I remember tadeass saying that he had a hard drive crash and lost all his files, which pretty much killed his motivation to start all over again.
Thats a pity...Really detailed
